Reviews.Content: Reality check To begin, Mariners Court is not one of those places you take public transportation to, get off and you're right in front of it. At the airport we got travel passes that included unlimited bus, ferry and rail. We went to Kings Cross station, exited on Victoria St and carried the bags down a couple of LONG flights of stairs. Don't do this. I recommend getting off at Circular Quay and then transferring to the Bus 311. This drops you off right in front of McElhone St. That's IF you want to stay here...The owners were a contradiction of friendliness and panderers. They made us feel like we were in complete error in getting the transport passes (which we got value from!) and should've hauled in on a taxi. They questioned our reasoning for getting the family room with three guys travelling. The proprietress simply said you don't have children and are you family? When I made initial enquiry on their website which is very user unfriendly and not very detailed, I originally requested there would be 3 adults staying. I was informed on a response email that I would have to book the family room. I only accepted what was offered to me. To be questioned upon checkin we were made to feel in error. They did honor the booking, however it was a distasteful experience. The family room is broken up into 2 rooms, one a master room done up quite nicely, the other room with 3 beds really needed a paint job and a bit more character. The bathrooms were very dated and a previous reviewer hit it spot on, this was a renewed old folks home with all the handle bars in the shower and wrap around shower curtain. Mold everywhere on the ceiling and that sliding door contraption with no lock. Beds were comfortable enough. Sufficient towels and linens.The breakfast on the 1st floor is alright. They had a great coffee machine. Toast, boiled eggs, peach slices, cereal, yogurt, juices, milk, jams and butter. They usually would throw in one special item that was different for each day such as watermelon, coldcuts/cheese, etc but were not there every day. The elevators are slow, memories of visiting grandfather in the home...the neighborhood is a bit alarming. We saw a couple laying in a cardboard box one day shooting up with needles. We also saw stray needles along the path (beware if you wear flipflops or open toe shoes!) to the stairs up to Potts Point. It has an old town feel and a worn down urbanity. I did like the Frisco Hotel pub around the corner. Great meals for cheap $10 but beware they can be small, albeit tasty. Good beer too. Tried the meatpies at Harry's little shack across the street. They were OK. I saw a photo of Col. Sanders eating there from KFC fame..the mashed potatoes and gravy plus peas they put called a Tiger is not far from that KFC taste. Be sure to explore Potts Point above Woolloomooloo. They have a wide variety of choices for all socio-economical prices. Mixture of chic, porn, backpackers, bar scene... etc...international cuisine. Oxford Street and Darlinghurt are also good escapes. I disliked this property mainly because of the owners. They seemed to kind of help but it was in a very stodgy way. Very much a look down mentality on their guests. If I wanted to be judged I would go to a real court instead of Mariners Court. I avoided them throughout the stay.
Reviews.Author: boxjelly

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!       Part of our room (well that area is about all of it actually)
Reviews.Author: TACIncinerator

Reviews.Content: You will not find a better place to stay in Sydney for the price I'm just at the end of a one month stay at the Mariner's Court Hotel. The accomodation is located in the great area of Woolloomooloo, and it's an easy walk to the City through the Domain or Botanical Gardens. The rooms are nicely furnished with just the right balance of character and modern comfort.There's minimal street noise, which in my experience is hard to find in Sydney.Lesley and Robert who manage the place are friendly and helpful, always ready for a chat and to help out with any queries.The included breakfast is an added bonus.Totally recommended, I don't really want to leave!Gary
Reviews.Author: Gushead

Reviews.Content: A Great Place to Stay This hotel is excellent value. The rooms are small, comfortable and cleaned daily. The place is secure and has a great location near the harbour. A lovely walk to the Opera House and near to Potts Point and King's Cross and the CBD. A bus passes close by. Excellent breakfasts and the staff are all very helpful and friendly. Excellent for the mature traveller who wants a clean, safe room with adecent breakfast and a good location. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: pkruger777

Reviews.Content: Loved Woolloomooloo Got off to an interesting start when I arrived with a bout of gastro - luckily there is a doctor right next door to this hotel! It was such comfort to be able to see someone straight away. The hotel itself has a fantastic, healthy free breakfast and the rooftop area is brilliant for catching some sun and having a read in the morning. The room itself is average sized, small televisions but hey, that's not what you're in a new city for is it. Every room has a small balcony which an absolute rarity in modest priced hotels these days. The bathrooms could possibly do with a renovation but they are clean enough. The location is brilliant, the opera house/circular quay/harbour bridge is an easy and pretty 20 minute walk through the botanical gardens. Kings Cross also at your doorstep for those who enjoy a bit of nightlife and excellent food on nearby Victoria Street!
Reviews.Author: lizardoqueen

Reviews.Content: Good Value We stayed here for three nights towards the end of February.Our room was acceptable, with fridge, tea  coffee making facilities, air con  a fan. There was a tiny balcony but we couldn't open the door! The view was not exciting anyway, but it was peaceful - no traffic noise.The bathroom was pretty tired and in need of a refit or at least a good clean, but it was functional.Breakfast was good, though 'non chinese' guests were not allowed to try the chinese style breakfast which was a pity because it looked interesting!The staff were very helpful on check-in  check-out and we did not need them at any other time.The walk to the city centre through the botanical gardens is quite delightful, but tiring later on after a day sight seeing. we tried to catch a bus one day but the traffic was so heavy it took for ever. We walked back late at night on one occasion and I felt slightly uneasy, though we were fine.On another occasion we walked to the Kings Cross Train station which wasn't far.There are several restaurants close by, and on our last night we stumbled upon Potts Point which also had god restaurants and a good atmoshpere, we would have liked to have returned there.All in all this hotel is fantastic value for money being MUCH cheaper than most. We would probably stay here again.
Reviews.Author: ChrisF

Reviews.Content: Ready for a nursing home yet? The main problem with this hotel is the atmosphere - it's a former nursing home that the current owner/s haven't spent a lot of money converting to a hotel. It's very beige, with wide doors and corridors for wheelchairs and trolleys, and emergency buttons still in the rooms and showers. The pictures on the walls reminded me of a doctor's waiting room. If you look closely, you can see the rear entrance where the ambulances would collect/drop off patients/residents. I read on a website it's a heritage building - but it looked 1970s/80s to me.The staff were OK - quite helpful and friendly - but not really apologetic that our booking was mucked up (at their end) - which meant we had to move rooms. One room was OK but the next had a hairdryer that didn't work and a door that only locked from the outside. The rooms were clean enough, but the bathrooms looked a bit tired and the shower tiles needed a good scrub.We were there in late summer and the place was pretty airless and stuffy. There is aircon and fans. You could open the doors to get air, but every night but one there seemed to be guests smoking in the courtyard/s, although the whole place is meant to be a non-smoking.The breakfast was OK and the location of the hotel is good, but I would be careful walking around this area late at night - it's still known for muggings - although I suppose that happens in many inner areas in large cities.This place was full when we were there, and the price must be the main attraction - we paid around AUD120 for a room and breakfast which was very good value for central Sydney. There are pubs/clubs/restaurants close and the harbour is just down the road. The city centre and its attractions are only a short walk.If you want atmosphere this is NOT your place - but for price and location it's a good option.
Reviews.Author: tongi

Reviews.Content: Great value for money Stayed for 4 nights at this small friendly hotel. We thought it was a good location and the walk through the botanical gardens to the city centre a bonus. The location was fine and close to the 'up and coming' Woolamaloo area. it was also close to Kings Cross area and we felt that was OK too. All in all no probs with location - OK it's not in darling harbour, it hasn't got a view of the opera house/Harbour bridge but at the end of the end how often do you sit in your room all day looking at the 'sights'??? No...you end up sightseeing!!The hotel owners were extremely helpful and when we arrived early morning we were immediately booked into a room - a blessing after a long flight. Breakfast was good too - you can have breakfast al fresco weather permitting. The owners were extremely accomodating. This accomodation was good value for money in an expensive city. You are close to trendy Fingers Wharf and the famous 'Harry de Wheels' pie van. If we were in Sydney we would stay here again. It probably doesn't have the frills of the more expensive hotels but as long as the room is clean, functional and staff are freindly - what more could you ask for? The rooms were cleaned daily and had a fridge, ironing facilities, TV and we had a small balcony.
Reviews.Author: Dol123

Reviews.Content: A little Gem. We stayed at the Mariners Court Hotel over new years eve and what a great location this hotel was in. it is about a 15 minute walk to the opera house through the Botanic gardens. the man at reception i believe his name was Robert, was an absolute gentleman who runs an excellent establishment. he was helpful on all aspects of sydney. the room was excellent too, clean fresh towels everyday and the continental breakfast was a surprise too. i was a bit surprised by some of the comments that was made about this hotel with regards to it's location, it is in a area called wooloomooloo think i spelled it right. Harrys pie shop is at the end of the street which makes it full of tourists. we had absolutely no problems. believe me i seen 5 star hotels in sydney in worse areas. the price is good too for this little gem. for what you get you get a whole lot more. i could not praise this place enough. if you want to enjoy this beautiful city but do not want to pay the prices, stay at the mariners court. you won't be dissapointed.
Reviews.Author: misscookieDonegal

Reviews.Content: Very nice We stayed there for 5 nights and really enyoed it.It was clean, nice beds, tv, fridge.. Good breakfast.The location is good if you are not a party person. You can walk to the operahouse and the city centre but you might wanna take taxi home.
Reviews.Author: kolabollar

Reviews.Content: Great value The Lonely Planet is right: it's not the most charming hotel in Sydney - but it might be the best bargain! Location's great: Sydney Opera House is half an hour away on foot through the Royal Botanical Gardens and Kings Cross railway station is a 15 minute walk. Rooms are equipped with a fridge (very handy) and TV and alarm clock. Bathroom's very basic, but works and is kept clean. In all, a very good base to explore Sydney - because all you do there is sleep anyway, spend the rest of your time in the greatest city on the Southern Hemisphere!
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06

Reviews.Content: What a find I stayed here for a week in September 2007, and cannot praise the hotel highly enough. I had forewarned them that I would be arriving around 07.30, the managers had said that I could leave my bag, take breakfast, and be guaranteed of my room by 10.00, whereas in fact they made it immediately available. Likewise, I was allowed to delay check-out. The staff were all both helpful and friendly. Bearing in mind that this is a budget hotel, the rooms are of adequate size, and well equipped, with a small balcony. The breakfast, which comes as part of the deal, is excellent value. The area is quiet, but also one of those parts of Sydney that hasn't abandoned any character under the impact of tourism: there are some excellent, and in the case of The Old Fitzroy, mildly quirky, pubs close to hand (the latter having a terrific and extremely reasonably priced bistro). Wooloomooloo is ideal for access both to the city, and such area as Potts Point. If you're after concierges, expensive views, and over-pricing, Mariners Court is not for you; but for excellent value and comfort, it would be hard to beat.
Reviews.Author: Neuendorf

Reviews.Content: Great value, centrally located  Stayed here for three weeks in March '07. Found the hotel to be modern, clean and well run with rooms equiped with all mod cons. The hotel also had complimentry movies, snooker and a great sun roof terrace. The complimentry breakfast was very good quality. The management were very helpful, kind and courteous. The hotel itself is a short stroll from all amenities. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here very much indeed. Great value, centrally located and hard to beat. John  Victoria, Dublin, Ireland.
Reviews.Author: john_vicky

Reviews.Content: Great value Had previously booked hotel for daughters first trip to Sydney and they had such a good experience that they stayed again at end of holiday. We were on an overnight up from Tasmania to get the return flights back to UK. Reception very helpful on arrival.Room on the small size but adequate and clean. Traffic noise negligable but did experience some late night noise from adjacant housing (however this was first night of Easter break so people enjoying themselves!). Compimentary breakfast good and nice to sit outside on sunny balcony. Checkout good - able to store bags all day as flight very late afternoon. Given use of bathroom to freshen up before shuttle bus arrived. Will stay again.Recommended pub 20 seconds around corner - good food and from balcony nice to watch fruit bats gliding silently up road opposite. Harrys cafe de wheels only 1 minute walk for extra late night pie snack. 20 minutes stroll through Botanic Gardens gets you to the must see view of opera house and bridge but look for the fruit bat colony on the way!Only downside, if sutch, would like hotel to have own website to book direct.
Reviews.Author: potaroo

Reviews.Content: Relaxed pleasant stay We had never been to Woolloomooloo side of Sydney, so thought we would sample a different area. We got a very reasonable rate with Wotif (3 day special) In fact we added to our time at Mariners Court by a couple of nights, we just had to move rooms  so we had the chance to sample 2 rooms. The rooms were spacious enough for us, beds comfy, decor lovely. Each had a small open balcony but we didnt use them. The rooms had fridge, kettle, tv (one had a dvd player) lots of milk  tea/coffee. Had free movies too. The complimentary breakfast was great, in fact because we arrived a bit early they offered us breakfast on the day we arrived. It had fruit, yoghurts, different coffees, toasts, cereals etc. Really relaxed atmosphere with lovely music accompanying the breakfast  complimentary papers. There was also a large open balcony to sit in the sun with your breakfast - heaven. We used the large games room on the day we were leaving to watch movies  chill, because our checkout was 10, but we werent being picked up for a couple of hours. The area was fine for us, just one minute walk to the wharf road, round the corner from a chilled pub  only another mini stroll to lots of cosmopolitan bars  restaurants. The walk through the botanic gardens to CBD was gorgeous (approx 15-20mins or about 7 bucks in a cab)  we always got a paper  a sandwich to enjoy on the grass watching the quay views before we hit the opera house crowds. I think some of the comments I read on this site did not reflect the stay that I  my husband enjoyed. Maybe things have all changed since others stayed in 05, I personally would recommend this lovely place to anyone.
Reviews.Author: trackerc

Reviews.Content: Watch Out! Booked after seeing attractive photos. Main problem with hotel is its location. Do not stay here is you want to use public transport. The short walk to Kings Cross Station is scary and we were stopped by police and told that it was an area that should not be walked through as it is a common area for assault and theft. This was IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DAY... We had to catch taxis at night because we were not willing to walk through the area at night...Rooms are small but clean. Bathroom had got to the stage where it can't be cleaned anymore, the dirt is stuck in the cracks in the tiles.Very noisy and unsavoury area at night... balcony looked onto the next apartment block which was 1 metre from the window...For a similar or better price accomodation can be found in a much better safer area and actually in the city... Don't be fooled by hotel managements sale line that the hotel is out of the unsavoury area and that we walked through the wrong way...We left the hotel very unhappy and unable to get a refund after being told not to walk around the hotel at night which severely inconvenienced our plans...
Reviews.Author: SydneyVisiter

Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable Stay. This is our 3rd time staying at Mariners Court and everytime we have been very happy. The hotel has a warm inviting feel, not the cold, sameness of some hotels, with friendly helpful management who know the area well. The breakfast is set out in an area on the 1st floor with a couryard that lets in the morning sun. A great place to start the day, read the papers, talk to other guests. The rooms are not modern, but very comfortable and clean and have all you want, TV ensuite etc. The hotel is also very close to most of the attractions, such as the Opera House, Art Gallery. We have already booked our return visit and certainly recommend to others.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: fabulous find Just spent 3 nights in this hotel ,cost around 拢180 for triple.Found the rooms basic but clean,with TV,fridge,kettle and toaster,plenty of tea,coffee  milk provided.There was also a pool table,free in house movies,also a gas barbeque for guests use.also a microwave on 3 rd floor for guests use,plenty of books in TV room .The so called complimentary breakfast was brilliant,fruit juce cereal,fruit(tinned),jam,marmalade,peanut butter,honey,there was a big enough selection to keep you going all day.Location was superb in a quiet back water a stones throw from the world famous Harrys Cafe de Wheels,most of Sydneys major attractions are within walking distance.Not a back packers hotels,OK for families,would certainly go again,excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: absolutely appalled! Upon arriving at the Mariners Court Hotel we were treated courteously and told our room would not be ready for a few hours, which was fine and with some helpful tips from the receptionist told of the sights to see. Finally the room was available, dissappointed, one courtyard to share, spoken to like children on the volume of noise after 10p.m. and about the $500.00 no argue fine if the smoke alarm went off, its not what we were told, it was HOW it was told to us. On averting a potential disaster in the breakfast area where guests were placed in harms way we were told not to help upon which another guest jumped into our defence of only wanting to help. Then when asking to simply change our bus transfer time it seemed so much trouble and eventually had to arrange this ourselves. The worst was when coming to settle a simple phone account of just a few small dollars, we were asked to go shopping and come back with change! We found staff to be very dissallusioned and not treated with respect. Word of mouth is the best form of advertising and I feel the Mariners Court are doing themselves a huge disservice just by handling things the way they do, we were appalled at our visit and will never return, and will go to great lengths to disway others from ever giving them patronage.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great family hotel in Sydney Family of 4 (parents + 2 teens) just spent an enjoyable weekend at the Mariner's Court Hotel in Woolloomooloo. Good impression to start with: when the family room wasn't available but they offered two adjacent rooms at the same price, which was extremely reasonable. Lovely courtyards, balconies, etc., also a games room with a pool table. A bonus: continental breakfast is included in the price. Staff could not have been more helpful, the location was tops (down the road from the historic Harry's Cafe de Wheels, near the wharf, lots of places to eat), walking distance to the Opera House, etc. (or $7 by taxi). We will stay there again. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Dacquiri
